collectors.title: Database
collectors.titleDetails: (8 total Queries, 8 of them unique across 1 Connection)

queries.sql:
select *, tc.status
        from tbl_clients as tc, tbl_firm as tf
        where tc.fID = tf.firmID
        and tc.fID = 1

select wpID,wp.added_by,wp.client, wp.auditor, wp.supervisor,wp.audmanager, wp.firm,wp.jobdur,wp.financial_year,wp.end_financial_year,wp.status,wp.remarks,wp.added_on, (select COUNT(*) from tbl_client_c1 as tc1 where tc1.wpID = wp.wpID and tc1.cID = wp.client) as x1, (select COUNT(*) from tbl_client_c2 as tc2 where tc2.wpID = wp.wpID and tc2.cID = wp.client) as x2, (select COUNT(*) from tbl_client_c3 as tc3 where tc3.wpID = wp.wpID and tc3.cID = wp.client) as x3, (select COUNT(*) from tbl_client_c1 as tc1 where tc1.wpID = wp.wpID and tc1.cID = wp.client and updated_on IS NOT NULL) as y1, (select COUNT(*) from tbl_client_c2 as tc2 where tc2.wpID = wp.wpID and tc2.cID = wp.client and updated_on IS NOT NULL) as y2, (select COUNT(*) from tbl_client_c3 as tc3 where tc3.wpID = wp.wpID and tc3.cID = wp.client and updated_on IS NOT NULL) as y3, (select COUNT(*) from tbl_client_file_index as cfi where cfi.wpID = wp.wpID and cfi.cID = wp.client and cfi.acquired = 'Yes' and cfi.status = 'Reviewing') as ir, (select COUNT(*) from tbl_client_file_index as cfi where cfi.wpID = wp.wpID and cfi.cID = wp.client and cfi.acquired = 'Yes' and cfi.status = 'Checking') as ic, (select COUNT(*) from tbl_client_file_index as cfi where cfi.wpID = wp.wpID and cfi.cID = wp.client and cfi.acquired = 'Yes' and cfi.status = 'Approved') as ia, (select COUNT(*) from tbl_client_file_index as cfi where cfi.wpID = wp.wpID and cfi.cID = wp.client and cfi.acquired = 'Yes') as ti, (select CONCAT(name,' - ',type) from tbl_users as tu where tu.userID = wp.added_by) as added, (select CONCAT(name,' - ',type) from tbl_users as tu where tu.userID = wp.auditor) as aud, (select CONCAT(name,' - ',type) from tbl_users as tu where tu.userID = wp.supervisor) as sup, (select CONCAT(name,' - ',type) from tbl_users as tu where tu.userID = wp.audmanager) as audm, tc.name as cli, tc.org from tbl_workpaper as wp, tbl_clients as tc where wp.firm = 1 and tc.cID = wp.client and wp.status != 'Approved'

      As a firm, we acknowledge that we have an obligation to serve our clients and our profession. The primary goal of our firm is to fulfill these obligations and deliver high-quality work:<br>

- To be involved in and contribute to the advancement of the accountancy profession and our community.<br>
- To provide within the firm the opportunity for personal and professional advancement, growth in skills and personal interrelationships, and rewarding work experiences.<br>
- To maintain our scope of service and circle of clientele by developing and improving special skills and expertise.

      At Juan Dela Cruz, CPA, we strive to build lasting, professional relationships with our clients based on trust, integrity, and shared goals. Our approach prioritizes:<br>
- Independence and Transparency: Ensuring objectivity and impartiality in every engagement.<br>
- Tailored Solutions: Understanding each client’s unique operations and providing audit services that address specific needs.<br>
- Clear Communication: Keeping clients informed throughout the audit process, explaining complex matters with clarity and professionalism.<br>
- Confidentiality: Safeguarding client information and ensuring it is used strictly for professional purposes.<br>
- Shared Success: Supporting our clients’ financial health and compliance to strengthen their relationships with stakeholders.<br>
- We see our role as auditors not just as evaluators but as partners in promoting trust and confidence in the financial reporting process.

      Superior client service is our primary objective and operating guideline, within the confines of law and professional standards. We seek to provide this service by making the full extent of our professional capabilities available to each client, ensuring their varying needs are met on a timely basis.<br>
Professional work that is outside of our areas of experience and expertise is not accepted. Often the client or potential client is referred to other professionals with appropriate skills and experience.
In seeking to provide excellent professional service to each client, we approach each engagement, large or small, with the following objectives:<br>
- Obtain thorough knowledge of the client and their industry, in order to properly evaluate the risks. events and conditions affecting it and its financial position and progress.<br>
- Accurately evaluate the strengths and weaknesses of the client's internal accounting and administrative controls, its accounting and administrative information systems and its other features, in order to effectively advise the client and fulfill the engagement objectives.<br>
- Identify and communicate situations and potential actions that appear to be opportunities for improving the client's operations and conditions.<br>
- Be alert to areas of personal assistance to the owner-manager of client firms, so that our services may be of maximum benefit to the client.

      At Juan Dela Cruz, CPA, we strive to build lasting, professional relationships with our clients based on trust, integrity, and shared goals. Our approach prioritizes:<br>
- Independence and Transparency: Ensuring objectivity and impartiality in every engagement.<br>
- Tailored Solutions: Understanding each client’s unique operations and providing audit services that address specific needs.<br>
- Clear Communication: Keeping clients informed throughout the audit process, explaining complex matters with clarity and professionalism.<br>
- Confidentiality: Safeguarding client information and ensuring it is used strictly for professional purposes.<br>
- Shared Success: Supporting our clients’ financial health and compliance to strengthen their relationships with stakeholders.<br>
- We see our role as auditors not just as evaluators but as partners in promoting trust and confidence in the financial reporting process.

      Superior client service is our primary objective and operating guideline, within the confines of law and professional standards. We seek to provide this service by making the full extent of our professional capabilities available to each client, ensuring their varying needs are met on a timely basis.<br>
Professional work that is outside of our areas of experience and expertise is not accepted. Often the client or potential client is referred to other professionals with appropriate skills and experience.
In seeking to provide excellent professional service to each client, we approach each engagement, large or small, with the following objectives:<br>
- Obtain thorough knowledge of the client and their industry, in order to properly evaluate the risks. events and conditions affecting it and its financial position and progress.<br>
- Accurately evaluate the strengths and weaknesses of the client's internal accounting and administrative controls, its accounting and administrative information systems and its other features, in order to effectively advise the client and fulfill the engagement objectives.<br>
- Identify and communicate situations and potential actions that appear to be opportunities for improving the client's operations and conditions.<br>
- Be alert to areas of personal assistance to the owner-manager of client firms, so that our services may be of maximum benefit to the client.
